description: Open Energy Platform (OEP) metadata schema latest

name.description: A filename or database conform collection name.
name.title: Collection Name

id.description: A unique identifier (UUID/DOI) for the collection.
id.title: Collection identifier

resources.description: A collection of related data resource descriptions and metadata. This may include relational data models which are technically related

name.description: A filename or database conform table name.
name.title: Name

path.description: A unique identifier (URI/UUID/DOI) for the table or file.
path.title: Path

description.description: A description of the table. It should be usable as summary information for the table that is described by the metadata.
description.example: Example table used to illustrate the oemetadata structure and meaning.
description.title: Description

subject.description: References to the topics of the resource in ontology terms.

name.description: The class label of the OEO term.
name.title: Name

path.description: The URI of the ontology class.
path.title: Path

subject.title: Subject

languages.description: A list of languages used within the described data structures (e.g. titles, descriptions) or metadata.

items.description: The language keys must follow the Standard IETF (BCP47) and can be repeated if more languages are used.
items.title: Language

languages.title: Languages

keywords.description: A list of string keywords to assist users searching for the package in catalogs.

items.description: The keyword are used and managed in the OEP as table tags.
items.title: Keyword

keywords.title: Keywords

publicationDate.description: A date of publication. The date format is ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DD).
publicationDate.title: Publication Date

embargoPeriod.description: An object that describes the embargo period during which public access to the data is not allowed.

start.description: The start date of the embargo period.
start.title: Embargo Period Start

end.description: The end date of the embargo period. This is the intended publication date.
end.title: Embargo Period End (Publication Date)

isActive.description: A boolean key that indicates if the embargo period is currently active. Must be changed to False on the embargo period end date.
isActive.title: Embargo Period is Active

embargoPeriod.title: Embargo Period

context.description: An Object that describes the general setting, environment or project leading to the creation or maintenance of this dataset. In science this can be the research project.

documentation.description: A URL of the project's documentation.
documentation.title: Documentation

sourceCode.description: A URL of the projects source code.
sourceCode.title: Source Code

contact.description: A reference to the creator or maintainer of the data set. This can be an email address or a GitHub handle.
contact.title: E-Mail Contact

grantNo.description: An identifying grant number. In case of a publicly funded project, this number is assigned by the funding agency.
grantNo.title: Grant no

fundingAgency.description: In a funded project this is the funding agency, which can be a governmental or a company.
fundingAgency.title: Funding agency

fundingAgencyLogo.description: A URL to the logo or image of the funding agency.
fundingAgencyLogo.title: Funding agency logo

publisherLogo.description: A URL to the logo of the agency publishing the data.
publisherLogo.title: Publisher logo

context.title: Context

spatial.description: An object that describes the spatial context of the data it contains.

location.description: A location of the data. In case of data where the location can be described as a point. May be specified as coordinates, URI or addresses with street, house number and zip code.
location.title: Location

extent.description: A covered area. May be the name of a region, or the geometry of a bounding box.
extent.title: Extent

resolution.description: Pixel size in case of a regular raster image. Reference to administrative level or other spatial division that is present as the smallest spatially distinguished unit size.
resolution.title: Resolution

spatial.title: Spatial

temporal.description: An object with the time period covered in the data. Temporal information should either contain a "referenceDate" or the keys describing a time series; in rare cases both.

referenceDate.description: The base year, month or day. Point in time for which the data is meant to be accurate. The census data or a satellite image will have a reference date. Date Format is ISO 8601.
referenceDate.title: Reference date

timeseries.description: A list of objects that describe the timeseries. It contains start, end, resolution, alignment and aggregation type properties.

start.description: The beginning point in time of a time series.
start.title: Start

end.description: The end point in time of a time series.
end.title: End

resolution.description: The time span between individual points of information in a time series.
resolution.title: Resolution

alignment.description: An indicator whether stamps in a time series are left, right or middle.
alignment.title: Alignment

aggregationType.description: Indicates whether the values are a sum, average or current.
aggregationType.title: Aggregation type

timeseries.title: Timeseries

temporal.title: Temporal

sources.description: List of source objects. Each object has all name-value-pairs.

items.description: Source object in list of source objects. Each object has all name-value-pairs.

title.description: A human readable title of the source, a document title or organisation name.
title.title: Title

description.description: A free text description of the data set.
description.example: Scientific climate change report by the UN
description.title: Description

path.description: A URL to the original source.
path.title: Path

licenses.description: The license(s) under which the source(s) is/are provided. List of objects.

items.description: A license object under which the described source is provided. Each object has all name-value-pairs.

title.description: The official (human readable) title of the license.
title.example: Open Data Commons Open Database License 1.0
title.title: Title

path.description: A link to the license text.
path.title: Path

instruction.description: A short description of rights and restrictions. The use of tl;drLegal is recommended.
instruction.example: You are free to share and change, but you must attribute, and share derivations under the same license. See https://tldrlegal.com/license/odc-open-database-license-(odbl) for further information.
instruction.title: Instruction

attribution.description: The copyright owner of the source. Copyright owner name must be acknowledged if attribution licenses are used.
attribution.title: Attribution

copyrightStatement.description: A link or path that proves that the source or data has the appropriate license.
copyrightStatement.title: Copyright Statement

items.title: Licenses

licenses.title: Licenses

items.title: Sources

sources.title: Sources

licenses.description: The license(s) under which the described package is provided. List of objects.

items.description: A license object under which the described package is provided. Each object has all name-value-pairs.

title.description: The official (human readable) title of the license.
title.example: Open Data Commons Open Database License 1.0
title.title: Title

path.description: A url-or-path string, that is a fully qualified HTTP address, or a relative POSIX path (see the url-or-path definition in Data Resource for details).
path.title: Path

instruction.description: A short description of rights and restrictions. The use of tl;drLegal is recommended.
instruction.example: You are free to share and change, but you must attribute, and share derivations under the same license. See https://tldrlegal.com/license/odc-open-database-license-(odbl) for further information.
instruction.title: Instruction

attribution.description: The copyright holder of the data set. If attribution licenses are used, that name must be acknowledged.
attribution.title: Attribution

items.title: Licenses

licenses.title: Licenses

provenance.description: An object that specifies provenance information of the data contained.

contributors.description: A list of objects that describe contributors and contributions. It contains title, path, organization, roles, date, object and comment.

title.description: A full Name of the contributor.
title.title: Title

path.description: A qualified URL pointing to a relevant location online for the contributor. This can be the GitHub page or ORCID.
path.title: Path

organization.description: A string describing the organization this contributor is affiliated to. This can be relevant for the copyright.
organization.title: Organization

roles.description: An array of strings describing the roles of the contributor.

items.description: A role is RECOMMENDED to follow an established vocabulary, such as DataCite Metadata Schema’s contributorRole or CreDIT. Useful roles to indicate are: creator, contact, and dataCurator.
items.title: Role

roles.title: Roles

date.description: The date of the final contribution. Date Format is ISO 8601.
date.title: Date

object.description: Target of contribution. Which part of the package was supplied or changed.
object.title: Object

comment.description: Free text comment on what has been done.
comment.title: Comment

contributors.title: Contributors

provenance.title: Provenance

type.description: A string that indicates that the resource is tabular as per Tabular Data definition. Use "table" for all tables.
type.title: Profile

format.description: A file extension format. Possible options are 'csv', 'xls', 'json' and other standard file extension for this type of resource. When you upload your data to the OEP, in the shown metadata string, the format will be changed accordingly to 'PostgreSQL', since the data is stored in a relational database.
format.title: Format

encoding.description: Specifies the character encoding of the resource's data file. The values should be one of the "Preferred MIME Names" for a character encoding registered with IANA. If no value for this key is specified then the default is UTF-8.
encoding.title: Encoding

schema.description: Object containing fields, primary key and for foreign keys. Describes the structure of the data.

items.description: Field object. Every object describes a column and provides name, description, type and unit.

name.description: The name of the field. The string must be unique within it's scope
name.title: Name

description.example: Reference year for which the data were collected.
description.title: Description

type.description: The data type of the field. In case of a geom column in a database, also indicate the shape and CRS.
type.title: Type

nullable.description: A boolean key to specify that a column can be nullable. True is the default value.
nullable.title: Nullable

unit.description: The unit, preferably SI-unit, that values in this field are mapped to. If 'unit' doesn't apply to a field, use 'null'. If the unit is given in a seperate field, reference this field.
unit.title: Unit

isAbout.description: Ontology URI to describe the column header

name.description: A class label of the OEO terms.
name.title: Name

isAbout.title: isAbout

valueReference.description: Ontology URI for an extended description of the values in the column

value.description: The name of the value in the column.
value.title: Value

name.description: The class label of the OEO terms.
name.title: Name

path.description: The URI of the OEO class
path.title: Path

valueReference.title: valueReference

items.title: Field

primaryKey.description: A primary key is a field or set of fields that uniquely identifies each row in the table. It's recorded as a list of strings, since it is possible to define the primary key as made up of several columns.

items.description: A primary key is a field or set of fields that uniquely identifies each row in the table.
items.title: Primary key

primaryKey.title: Primary key

items.description: A foreign key is a field that refers to a column in another table.

fields.description: The column (as list of items) in the table that is constrainted by the foreign key.

items.description: The column in the table that is constrainted by the foreign key.
items.title: Field

fields.title: Fields

reference.description: The reference to the foreign table.
reference.title: Reference

items.title: Foreign Key

schema.title: Schema

dialect.description: Object. A CSV Dialect defines a simple format to describe the various dialects of CSV files in a language agnostic manner. In case of a database, the values in the containing fields are "null".

delimiter.description: The delimiter specifies the character sequence which should separate fields (columns). Common characters are "," (comma), "." (point) and "\t" (tab).
delimiter.title: Delimiter

decimalSeparator.description: A symbol used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of a number written in decimal form. Depending on language and region this symbol can be "." or ",".
decimalSeparator.title: Decimal separator

dialect.title: Dialect

review.description: Data uploaded through the OEP needs to go through review. The review will cover the areas described here: https://github.com/OpenEnergyPlatform/data-preprocessing/wiki and carried out by a team of the platform. The review itself is documented at the specified path and a badge is rewarded with regards to completeness.

path.description: A URL or path string, that should be a permanent http(s) address directly linking to the documented review.
path.title: Path

badge.description: A badge of either Bronze, Silver, Gold or Platinum is used to label the given metadata based on its quality.
badge.title: Badge

review.title: Review

@id.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that links the resource via the OpenEnergyDatabus (DBpedia Databus).
@id.title: @Id

@context.description: Explanation of metadata keys in ontology terms.
@context.title: @context

user.description: The unique identifier for the wasGeneratedBy object.
user.title: Generated by (ID)

@type.description: The type of the wasGeneratedBy object.
@type.title: Generated by (type)

usedResource.description: A reference to the resource used. (ToDo)
usedResource.title: Resource used

metaMetadata.description: Description about the metadata themselves, their format, version and license. These fields should already be provided when you’re filling out your metadata.

metadataVersion.description: Type and version number of the metadata.
metadataVersion.title: Metadata Version

metadataLicense.description: Object describing the license of the provided metadata.

path.description: Url or path string, that is a fully qualified HTTP address.
path.title: Path

metadataLicense.title: Metadata License

metaMetadata.title: Meta Metadata
